title: Countries are starting to give wild animals legal rights. Here’s why.
description: A growing number of countries are granting legal rights to wildlife to combat the biodiversity crisis.

title: Tracking the path of Tropical Storm Idalia
description: Tracking the path of Tropical Storm Idalia.

title: They came to find the Loch Ness monster. What if they do?
description: Monster hunters armed with drones swarmed Inverness, Scotland for the biggest and most high-tech hunt in decades for Nessie, the Loch Ness monster.

title: Zimbabwe opposition alleges fraud in tense presidential vote
description: The country’s electoral commission declared incumbent President Emmerson Mnangagwa the winner of a vote observers  said fell short of international standards.

title: Russia confirms Wagner chief Prigozhin’s death after DNA tests
description: Yevgeniy Prigozhin and top Wagner leaders were killed when their private jet crashed north of Moscow on Wednesday. The true cause of the crash is unknown.

title: 3 Marines killed, 5 in serious condition after aircraft crash in Australia
description: The MV-22B Osprey was carrying 23 U.S. Marine Corps personnel when it crashed Sunday off the coast of Darwin, in Australia’s Northern Territory, officials said.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Lukashenko says he warned Prigozhin about safety; U.S. looking into crash’s cause
description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko claimed he had offered Wagner chief Yevgeniy Prigozhin “full security” before his presumed death last week.

title: Niger’s population struggles with daily life after coup
description: Electricity cuts, food price hikes and border closures are hitting hard in the already impoverished country.

title: Wagner chief Prigozhin’s lingering popularity a challenge for Putin
description: Makeshift memorials for Prigozhin, who is presumed dead, showed his support across Russia in pro-war circles, despite Putin tarnishing him as a traitor.
